Am i the only person that still cannot really do downward dog? I've been doing yoga with adriene for almost two months now but I'm still collapsing or shaking and can't get my heels near teh ground and it's really discouraging and takes me out of the practice. It seems like it's supposed to be an easyish resting pose but i just can't get the hang of it and now I think im overthinking it and beating myself up. Does anyone know of any adjustments for downward dog I can do? Sorry, don't mean to complain, I really have been enjoying these practices but I have noticed a pattern where whenever downward dog is mentioned I just check out mentally.

I think it can take a while for DD to feel like a resting pose, and there's people who've been doing it for years and can't get their heels on the ground yet! It can def be frustrating when you struggle with a pose, but it's important to work with where your body is at right now, rather than where you want it to be. I would maybe just try doing it for as long as you can each time, without pushing yourself to stay in the pose as long as the video. You might be surprised at how your strength can build up over time with patience and perseverance :)
